fr.upmc.components.registry

Class GlobalRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.registry.GlobalRegistry

  • public class GlobalRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    The class GlobalRegistry implements the global registry for the component model that registers connection information to remotely access components through their ports.

    Description

    The Registry implements a global registry for the component model allowing to bind port URI to information required for the connection between components through ports. The registry must be run on one host which name is given in the static variable REGISTRY_HOSTNAME. It listens to request on a port which number is given by the static variable REGISTRY_PORT Protocol (spaces are used to split the strings, so they are meaningful): 
     Requests              Responses
 
 lookup           ok 
                       nok
 put       ok
                       nok bound!
 remove           ok
                       nok not_bound!
 shutdown              ok
        nok unkonwn_command!
    When the static variable DEBUG is set to true, the registry provides with a log on STDOUT of the commands it executes.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2012-10-22

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEBUG0
      If true, an echo of some commands executed is provided on STDOUT.
      static boolean DEBUG1
      If true, a log of the commands executed is provided on STDOUT.
      static java.lang.String REGISTRY_HOSTNAME
      Default name of the host running the registry; is configurable.
      static int REGISTRY_PORT
      Registry port number listen for commands; is configurable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GlobalRegistry(java.lang.String configFileName)
      create a registry object, using the configuration file to know the number of clients that will connect, and therefore that will have to disconnect for the registry to terminate its execution.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      initialise and run the registry.
      void run()
      runs the registry, repeated accepting connections on its server socket, decoding the request (in the format defined by the above protocol), executing it and returning the result (in the format defined by the above protocol) on the output stream of the socket.
